clusters/index.title: Clusters
clusters/index.description: Kubernetes clusters in Palette are instantiated from cluster profiles. A cluster definition in Palette consists of a reference to a cluster profile, cloud configuration, as well as the cluster size and placement configuration. The following high-level tasks are performed as part of the cluster creation:

clusters/public-cloud/aws/add-aws-accoun.title: Register and Manage AWS Accounts
clusters/public-cloud/aws/add-aws-accoun.description: Palette supports integration with AWS Cloud Accounts. This also includes support for AWS GovCloud (US) accounts. This section explains how to create an AWS cloud account in Palette. You can use any of the following authentication methods to register your cloud account.

clusters/public-cloud/aws/architecture.title: Architecture
clusters/public-cloud/aws/architecture.description: The following are some architectural highlights of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) clusters that Palette provisions:

clusters/public-cloud/aws/index.title: AWS
clusters/public-cloud/aws/index.description: Palette supports integration with Amazon Web Services. You can deploy and manage Host Clusters in AWS. To get  started check out the Register and Manage AWS Accounts.

clusters/public-cloud/index.title: Public Cloud Clusters
clusters/public-cloud/index.description: Palette supports provisioning and end-to-end lifecycle management of Kubernetes clusters (workload clusters) on various public cloud environments. Palette supports provisioning new clusters on public clouds using the cloud provider's infrastructure by provisioning new VMs for control plane and worker pools and through their managed Kubernetes services such as EKS, AKS, GKE, and more.

introduction/introduction.title: What is Palette?
introduction/introduction.description: Palette is a complete and integrated platform that enables organizations to effectively manage the entire lifecycle of any combination of new or existing, simple or complex, small or large Kubernetes environments, whether in a data center or the cloud.

introduction/palette-modes.title: App Mode and Cluster Mode
introduction/palette-modes.description: Palette supports two consumption modes - each aimed at different use cases and, potentially, different personas. The two modes are App Mode and Cluster Mode.  These modes can be used separately but often work together by sharing resources or relying on resources that each provides.
